gurmukhi: nv nyvr nwd surM niRmlM ] muK ib`jul jÍwl GxM pRjulM ]
transliteration: Nav Nevar Naad Suran Nrimalan|| Moukh Bijjul Jvaal Ghanan Prajulan||
translation: Various kinds of pure tunes emanate from the anklets. The face appears like the in blaze of lightning the dark clouds.

gurmukhi: mdrw kr m`q mhw BBkM ] bn mY mno bwG bcw bbkM ]53]
transliteration: Madraa Kar Matt Mahaa Bhabbakaaan|| Ban Mai Mano Baagh Bachaa Babakan||53||
translation: His gait is like that of an elephant, intoxicated with wine. His loud thunder appears like the roar of a cub in the forest.53

gurmukhi: Bv BUq Biv`K Bvwn Bvwn BvM ] kl kwrx aubwrn eyk quvM ]
transliteration: Bhav Bhoot Bhavikkh Bhavaan Bhavan|| Kal Kaaran Oubaaran Ek Tuvan||
translation: Thou art in the world in the past, future and present. Thou art the ONLY ONE Saviour in the Iron age.

gurmukhi: sB TOr inrMqr in`q nXM ] miRdu mMgl rUp quXM su BXM ]54]
transliteration: Sabh Thaur Nirantar Nitt Nayan|| Mrid(u) Mandal Roop Tuyan Su Bhayan||54||
translation: Thou art ever new continuously at all places. Thou appearest impressive and sweet in Thy Blissful form.54.

gurmukhi: idV dwVH krwl dÍY syq auDM ] ijh Bwjq dust iblok juDM ]
transliteration: Did Daadh Karaal Dvai Set Udhan|| Jih Bhaajat Doust Bilok Judhan||
translation: Thou hast two grinder teeth. Terrible, white and high, seeing which the tyrants run away from the battlefield.

gurmukhi: md mq kiRpwx krwl DrM ] jX s`d surwsurXM aucrM ]55]
transliteration: Mad Mat Kridaan Karaal Dharan|| Jay Sadd Suraasurayan Oucharan||55||
translation: Thou art inebriated, holding the terrible sword in Thy hand. Both the gods and demons sing the eulogy of His victory.55.

gurmukhi: nv ikMkx nyvr nwd hUAM ] cl cwl sBwcl kMp BUAM ]
transliteration: Nav Kinkan Nevar Naad Hooan|| Chal Dhaal Sabhaachal Kanp Bhooan||
translation: When the united sound of the girdle bells and the anklets emantes, then all the mountains become restless like mercury and the earth trembles.

gurmukhi: Gx GuMGr GMtx Gor surM ] cr cwr crwcrXM huhrM ]56]
transliteration: Ghan Ghounghar Ghantan Ghor Suran|| Char Chaar Charaacharayan Huhran||56||
translation: When the constant jingling loud sound is heard, then all the movable and immovable objects become restless.56.

gurmukhi: cl cOdhUM c`kRn c`kR iPrM ] bFvM GtvM hrIAM suBrM ]
transliteration: Chal Chaudahoon Chakkran Chakkra Phiran|| Badhvan Ghatvan Darooan Soubhran||
translation: Thy weapons are used in all the fourteen worlds alongwith Thy Command, with which Thou causest deficiency in the augmented once and fill to the brim, the empty ones.

gurmukhi: jg jIv ijqy jlXM QlXM ] As ko ju qvwiesuAM mlXM ]57]
transliteration: Jag Jeev  Jite Jalayan Thalayan|| As Ko Ju Tavaaesuan Malayan||57||
translation: All the creatures of the world on land and in water, who is the amongst them, who hath the audacity to refuse Thy Command? 57.

gurmukhi: Gt Bwdv mws kI jwx suBM ] qn swvry rwvryAM hulsM ]
transliteration: Ghat Bhaadav Maas Koo Jaan Soubhan|| Tan Saavre Raavrean Hulasan||
translation: Just as the dark cloud seem impressive in the month of Bhadon, in the same manner Thy dark body hath its glow.

gurmukhi: rd pMgq dwmnIAM dmkM ] Gn GuMGr GMt surM GmkM ]58]
transliteration: Rad Panad Daamanndoan Damakan|| Ghan Ghounghar Ghant Suran Ghamakan||58||
translation: The chain of Thy teeth glitters like lightning, the melody of the small bells and gongs is like the thunder of the clouds. 58.

gurmukhi: Gtw swvxM jwx isAwmM suhwXM ] mxI nIl ngXM lKM sIs nXwXM ]
transliteration: Ghataa Saavanan Jaan Siaamannd Suhaayan|| Manoo Nool Nagadan Lakhannddsoos Nyaayan||
translation: Thy beauty appears elegant like the dark clouds of the month of Sawan , Comprehending Thy beautiful form, the mountain of blue gems hath bent its head.
